question_sentence: The Met Gala returned this week. What was this year’s theme?
Who was the first quarterback taken in this year’s NFL Draft?
This week is Teacher Appreciation Week, but what day was Teacher Appreciation Day?
Fossils of the largest type of which dinosaur were discovered in Argentina?
Which one of these artists is not a member of this year’s Rock and Roll Hall of Fame class?
A study published in the scientific journal "Nature Aging” found the sweet spot for sleeping among middle-aged and older people is:
Netflix announced this week it is rebooting which show?
A 100-year-old Brazilian man broke the Guinness World Record for longest career at the same company. How long has he been with his company?
A draft Supreme Court opinion that suggested the court is on the verge of overturning Roe v. Wade. How did the draft come to be published?
Cinco de Mayo was celebrated this week. What does it commemorate?
Tory MP Neil Parish claimed he accidentally ended up looking at online porn in the Commons after trying to research what?
evidence: The former Tory MP for Tiverton and Honiton resigned after admitting watching porn on his phone twice in the Commons. But he claimed to have mistakenly clicked on an adult site while searching for a Claas Dominator tractor

question_sentence: Which two areas in the north of England did Boris Johnson confuse while out campaigning for the local elections?
evidence: The prime minister confused the two in a tweet that has been deleted and replaced with a post referring to ‘the North East’

question_sentence: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are reportedly eyeing up which royal property to be their new family home?
evidence: The recently refurbished ‘grace and favour’ property is ten minutes’ walk from the Queen’s new official residence, Windsor Castle. Prince William and Kate Middleton are said to have been planning a move to Berkshire since last year

question_sentence: The UK Covid-19 public inquiry into the government’s handling of the crisis is being led by which former judge?
evidence: Former appeal court judge Hallett is aiming to begin public hearings next year, after analysing the findings of a recently concluded four-week public consultation

question_sentence: Snooker ace Ronnie O’Sullivan beat who to secure a record-equalling seventh World Championship title?
evidence: The 46-year-old claimed an 18-13 victory at the Crucible to equal Stephen Hendry’s seven world titles. He also set a new record as the oldest world snooker champion in history

question_sentence: Which Andrew Lloyd Webber musical is set to close in June, less than a year after its West End premiere?
evidence: Some angry cast members claim they only found out via social media that the show is to end on 12 June. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: A leaked draft opinion suggests at least how many of the nine US Supreme Court judges back overturning abortion rights?
evidence: The leaked draft ruling overturning the landmark Roe v. Wade decision was written by Justice Samuel Alito and signed by four other conservative judges. The 1973 decision guarantees federal constitutional protections of abortion rights

question_sentence: Which species has joined humans as the only known animals that can tell the difference between odd and even numbers?
evidence: A new study by Australian researchers found that honeybees capable of odd and even categorisation, also called parity classification. For more unlikely news, sign up for our weekly Tall Tales newsletter

question_sentence: Post Office workers staged a one-day strike this week over what?
choices: Plans to axe 270 staff and 30 branches
A proposed 2% pay rise following a pay freeze last year
Cuts to staff pensions and other benefits
evidence: Over 100 branches closed on Tuesday as around 2,000 workers walked out over what the Communication Workers Union described as the ‘exceptionally poor’ pay rise offer

question_sentence: Which London council, held by the Conservatives since its creation in 1964, fell to Labour in the local elections?
evidence: The Tories also lost control of their London strongholds  Wandsworth and Barnet to Labour, but Keir Starmer's party failed to make big inroads outside of London

question_sentence: Which historic Supreme Court decision may be overturned later this year?
evidence: In a stunning breach of Supreme Court confidentiality and secrecy, Politico obtained what it calls a draft of a majority opinion written by Justice Samuel Alito that would strike down Roe v. Wade – the law that affirms a woman’s right to have an abortion.

question_sentence: Which major automaker announced a massive recall of SUVs this week?
evidence: Up to a quarter million Ford Explorers are being recalled due to a mechanical problem that can cause the SUV to roll away while it’s parked.

question_sentence: Widely known as “fashion’s biggest night,” what exclusive party took place in New York City on Monday?
evidence: Celebrities wore their most striking outfits on the red carpet at the Met Gala. Check out some of the best moments and best looks here!

question_sentence: US and Western officials believe Russian President Vladimir Putin could formally declare war on Ukraine soon. On what day do they expect this to occur?
evidence: Officials believe Putin could formally declare war on Ukraine as soon as May 9 because it would coincide with “Victory Day” inside Russia, which commemorates the country’s defeat of the Nazis in 1945.

question_sentence: What percent of the US population has received a Covid-19 booster shot?
evidence: Only about 30% of the total US population has received a Covid-19 booster shot, according to the CDC’s latest data. However, 77.7% of Americans – or nearly 258 million people – have received at least one dose of the vaccine.

question_sentence: Which country endured an extreme heatwave this week that “tested the limits of human survivability,” according to a climate expert?
evidence: Temperatures over 100 degrees Fahrenheit in India continue to damage crops and put pressure on energy supplies in the region. In response, officials are urging residents to remain indoors and keep hydrated.

question_sentence: What piece of sports memorabilia recently fetched seven figures at an auction?
choices: Michael Jordan’s high school basketball shoes
evidence: A bat used by baseball hero Jackie Robinson in the 1949 All-Star Game sold at auction for $1.08 million.

question_sentence: The Biden administration announced a $3 billion investment this week to ramp up production of what critical items?
evidence: The Biden administration announced a bipartisan infrastructure package that will direct $3 billion toward the production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles to make the US more energy independent.

question_sentence: What state may issue unprecedented water restrictions unless residents and businesses cut back their usage?
evidence: Southern Californians are being asked to cut their water usage by 35% to avoid a full ban on watering later in the summer.

question_sentence: A unique hotel is scheduled to open in 2025. Where will it be located?
choices: The deepest part of the ocean
At the top of the Eiffel tower
evidence: A space hotel with a view of the solar system could be the future of travel!
